options.option: Hello! I'm Rindri's friend. It's a pleasure to meet you.

scene.text: [name], this is Jaedran. He's mute, so he isn't a great conversation partner. He's keeps the dojo clean though, the swords sharp, and he's a good swordsman.
You've always preferred getting lessons from me, though. I don't know why, but you never liked Jaedran.

options.option: That must've been a misunderstanding. I'm certain he's a nice person.
How does he teach if he's mute?
And for a good reason, I assume.

scene.text: Well, you don't need words to show swordsmanship.
Not to blow my own horn, but I'm a really good teacher as well. It's a shame you don't remember my great lessons.

options.option: Really? I'm so sorry to have forgotten about that.
Cool. You seem kind of young to teach though. Aren't we the same age?
Yeah, rub it in why don't you.

scene.text: I'm best swordsman in this region actually. And I'm the best archer in the province as well. When I get out of here, I'm going to join the king's royal guard.
Hehe, are you jealous? Just you wait, when I win the Recrest Gauntlet you're going to be honoured to have sparred with me.
If I'm feeling generous, I might even sign your practice sword. You'll have to come to me though, because I won't ever be returning to this freezing place.

options.option: That's amazing, Rindri! I'll definitely support you at the tournament.
You seem very sure of yourself.
That's quite an ego you've got there.

scene.text: Man [name], can't you just be supportive? Sheesh...
I'll be busy packing and heading for the capital once I've won. But I'm sure I can find the time to show you my medal and consciption letter.
It sucks that you'll probably never leave this place, what with your memory loss. Ah well, at least Jaedran will keep you company.
Anyways, let's move on. Conversations with Jaedran always get very one-sided.

options.option: Nice to have met you, Jaedran. Please teach me to fight sometime.
